fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Culture, Education and training, Enlargement, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Youth, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Climate Action

subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
CIVILSCAPE closely co-operates with UNISCAPE, the network of universities and research institutes for landscape research. 
 
CIVILSCAPE is member of the European Heritage Alliance and contributes to the network activities. 
 
CIVILSCAPE has been member of the European Year of Citizens 2013 Alliance and played an active role to involve their national and regional member organisations in the national coalitions. 
 
CIVILSCAPE has also signed the Rennewable Grid Declaration and promotes these ideas, concepts and best-practice example from different countries.  
 
CIVILSCAPE is member of the ARC2020 network and supports their work with contributions on local, regional and national level.
goals__remit:
Civilscape is an umbrella organization of NGOs dealing with landscape, landscape protection and landscape management. It is dedicated to the European Landscape Convention and has been approved as a participative international NGO by the Council of Europe. The main goals of Civilscape can be summed up in five key words: 
 
RESPONSIBILITY: We all have a great responsibility for our landscapes, for their sustainable development, cultural and natural wealth and the social wellbeing of their inhabitants. To care for the landscape is our mission. 
 
CIVIL ENGAGEMENT: Landscape is our responsibility – therefore we as citizens of a democratic society shall play an important role in all decision making processes concerning our landscapes, the way our landscapes are developed and how they are managed. We see the European landscapes as landscapes of the European citizens. 
 
PARTICIPATION: To take responsibility citizens must be able to participate on all levels of governance and administration, from local to European, from the first ideas of a planning process to the final implementation. For this citizens need to organize and we need strong NGOs – from local to international, who can make an impact. 
 
SOLIDARITY: NGOs are volunteer organisations with often small budgets. Many of the most active NGOs work on a local level and do fantastic grass root work – but are limited in their resources. We want to provide a strong network of NGOs which can help each other, share experiences, develop common projects, acquire funding and combine there different potentials and expertise. 
 
ADVOCACY: We act for the landscape – and an active and strong civil society. We are a participatory iNGO at the Council of Europe and are registered with the EU as advocates for the landscape and all related aspects. We work on a European level – and assist our members in their activities on local, regional and national level. 
 
ACCESS: It is often difficult for local and regional NGOs to participate in consultations, advocating the landscape and influence European policies. We act as ambassadors for our members at the European Institutions, keep them informed and assist them in their requests. We give access and together we can make an impact.
relevant_communication: Civilscape has a close co-operation with the Council of Europe on aspectes of landscape and heritage policy. With the EU it is e.g. very active in the European Mairitme Days, the European Year of the Cultural Heritage 2018. Civilscape is organizing its series of "Landscape Forums", regional events on landscape policy and research in the various Interreg-Regions with participants from the civil society, academia, regional and national governments. Civilscape is also actively involved in a number of research and disseniation projects under differrent EU funding schemes, llike FP7, Interreg-C or Erasmus+
